# Task Instructions

## What To Do

Usually you should try to do the thing when appropriate.

Sometimes the user might want something different, so maybe check first.

If possible, try to complete the task as much as possible.

Often the best approach is to do it when needed.

You should probably handle errors if possible, but rarely will you need to.

Sometimes it might be better to ask, but usually just try to figure it out.

As needed, you can sometimes skip steps that aren't usually required.

When appropriate, try to be thorough, but often a quick pass is fine.

This prompt is full of vague language that doesn't give clear direction.
